CleaningPipe#

class pipeline.CleaningPipe(*, prec_pipe=None, path_to_eeg=_Nothing.NOTHING, output_dir=_Nothing.NOTHING)[source]#

Bases: BasePipe

The cleaning pipeline element.

Contains resampling function, band and notch filters, browser for manual selection of bad channels and bad data spans.

Methods:

filter

A wrapper for mne.io.Raw.filter.

notch

A wrapper for mne.io.Raw.notch_filter.

plot

A wrapper for mne.io.Raw.plot().

read_annotations

Imports annotations from file to mne raw object

read_bad_channels

Imports bad channels from file to mne raw object.

resample

A wrapper for mne.io.Raw.resample with an additional option to save the resampled data.

save_raw

A wrapper for mne.io.Raw.save.

Attributes:

mne_raw

An instanse of mne.io.Raw.

output_dir

Path to the directory where the output will be saved.

path_to_eeg

Can be any file type supported by mne.io.read_raw().

prec_pipe

Preceding pipe that hands over mne_raw attr.

sf

A wrapper for mne.Info["sfreq"].
resample(sfreq=250, n_jobs='cuda', save=False)[source]#

A wrapper for mne.io.Raw.resample with an additional option to save the resampled data.

Parameters:

  • sfreq (float) – new sampling frequency. Defaults to 250.

  • n_jobs (int | str) – The number of jobs to run in parallel or CUDA. Defaults to “cuda”.

  • save (bool) – Whether to save a resampled data to a fif file. Defaults to False.

filter(l_freq=0.3, h_freq=None, picks=None, n_jobs='cuda')[source]#

A wrapper for mne.io.Raw.filter.

Parameters:

  • l_freq (Optional[float]) – the lower pass-band edge. Defaults to 0.3.

  • h_freq (Optional[float]) – the higher pass-band edge. Defaults to None.

  • picks (Union[str, Iterable[str], None]) – Channels to filter, if None - all channels will be filtered. Defaults to None.

  • n_jobs (int | str) – The number of jobs to run in parallel or CUDA. Defaults to “cuda”.

notch(freqs=None, picks='eeg', n_jobs='cuda')[source]#

A wrapper for mne.io.Raw.notch_filter.

Parameters:

  • freqs (Optional[Iterable]) – Frequencies to filter out from data, e.g. np.arange(50, 251, 50) for sampling freq 250 Hz. Defaults to None.

  • picks (str | Iterable[str]) – Channels to filter, if None - all channels will be filtered. Defaults to None.

  • n_jobs (int | str) – The number of jobs to run in parallel or CUDA. Defaults to “cuda”.

read_bad_channels(path=None)[source]#

Imports bad channels from file to mne raw object.

Parameters:

path – Path to the txt file with bad channel name per row. Defaults to None.

read_annotations(path=None)[source]#

Imports annotations from file to mne raw object

Parameters:

path – Path to txt file with mne-style annotations. Defaults to None.

mne_raw: mne.io.Raw#

An instanse of mne.io.Raw.

output_dir: Path#

Path to the directory where the output will be saved.

path_to_eeg: Path#

Can be any file type supported by mne.io.read_raw().

plot(butterfly=False, save_annotations=False, save_bad_channels=False, scalings='auto', use_opengl=False, overwrite=False)#

A wrapper for mne.io.Raw.plot().

Parameters:

  • butterfly (bool) – Whether to start in butterfly mode. Defaults to False.

  • save_annotations (bool) – Whether to save annotations as txt. Defaults to False.

  • save_bad_channels (bool) – Whether to save bad channels as txt. Defaults to False.

  • scalings (str | dict) – Scale for amplitude per channel type. Defaults to ‘auto’.

  • use_opengl (bool) – Whether to use OpenGL acceleration. Defaults to None.

  • overwrite (bool) – Whether to overwrite annotations and bad_channels files if exist. Defaults to False.

prec_pipe: Type[BasePipeType]#

Preceding pipe that hands over mne_raw attr.

save_raw(fname)#

A wrapper for mne.io.Raw.save.

Parameters:

fname (str) – filename for the fif file being saved.

property sf#

A wrapper for mne.Info[“sfreq”].

Returns:

sampling frequency

Return type:

float
